page.title: 02MARKET GARDENING
page.content: The NW corner of this area is part of a large market gardening enterprise spreading over a large part of the Howe of Fife.On a series of neighbouring farms intensive market gardening is practiced.This involves growing crops such as lettuce and cabbage,calabrese,beetroot etc.The ground is rigorously prepared before planting and small drills are formed for the plants.Over these perforated plastic sheeting is placed to reduce frost damage and improve growth.The crops are also regularly watered by means of a large sprinkler.The products are sold to the public from the farms but the bulk are marketed through chain stores such as M+S.This type of farming has only become important in the last 7 or 8 years.
